trans-unit.source: Serializes the view state for a Web Forms page.
This class cannot be inherited.
The limited object serialization (LOS) formatter is designed for highly compact ASCII format serialization.
This class supports serializing any object graph, but is optimized for those containing strings, arrays, and hash tables.
It offers second order optimization for many of the .NET Framework primitive types.
This is a private format and remains consistent only for the lifetime of a Web request.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.LosFormatter"></xref> class using default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.LosFormatter"></xref> class using the specified enable flag and machine authentication code (MAC) key modifier.
`true` to enable view-state MAC; otherwise, `false`.
The modifier for the MAC key.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.LosFormatter"></xref> class using the specified enable flag and machine authentication code (MAC) key modifier.
`true` to enable view-state MAC; otherwise, `false`.
The modifier for the MAC key.
Transforms the view-state value contained in a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object to a limited object serialization (LOS)-formatted object.
This version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.LosFormatter.Deserialize%2A> method is used to transform the view-state value contained in a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object to a LOS-formatted object.
Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> that contains the view-state value to transform.
A LOS-formatted object.
Transforms the view-state value contained in a <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> object to a limited object serialization (LOS)-formatted object.
This version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.LosFormatter.Deserialize%2A> method is used to transform the view-state value contained in a <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object to a LOS-formatted object.
Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
A <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> that contains the view-state value to transform.
A LOS-formatted object.
Transforms the specified view-state value to a limited object serialization (LOS)-formatted object.
This version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.LosFormatter.Deserialize%2A> method is used to transform the specified view-state value to a LOS-formatted object.
Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
The view-state value to transform.
A LOS-formatted object.
The view state is invalid.
Transforms a limited object serialization (LOS)-formatted object into a view-state value and places the results into a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object.
This version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.LosFormatter.Serialize%2A> method is used to transform a LOS-formatted object into a view-state value.
The results are then placed into a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to receive the transformed value.
The LOS-formatted object to transform into a view-state value.
Transforms a limited object serialization (LOS)-formatted object into a view-state value and places the results into a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object.
This version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.LosFormatter.Serialize%2A> method is used to transform a LOS-formatted object into a view-state value.
The results are then placed into a <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> object.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> to receive the transformed value.
The LOS-formatted object to transform into a view-state value.
